steps.title: How Memory Works
steps.content: Memory involves three key processes: encoding (taking in information), storage (keeping information), and retrieval (accessing stored information). Understanding these processes helps you develop better learning strategies.

quiz.question: The three key processes of memory are encoding, storage, and retrieval.

steps.title: The Forgetting Curve
steps.content: Hermann Ebbinghaus discovered that we forget most new information within hours if we don't review it. His 'forgetting curve' shows that regular review at increasing intervals dramatically improves long-term retention.

quiz.question: According to the forgetting curve, when should you first review new material?

steps.title: Memory Techniques
steps.content: Powerful memory techniques include visualization, association, and the method of loci. These techniques work by connecting new information to existing memories and creating vivid mental images.

quiz.question: Which technique involves connecting new information to familiar locations?

steps.title: Spaced Repetition Systems
steps.content: Spaced repetition involves reviewing information at increasingly longer intervals. This technique leverages the psychological spacing effect to transfer information from short-term to long-term memory efficiently.

quiz.question: Spaced repetition involves reviewing information at decreasing intervals.

modules.title: The Practitioner's Toolkit
modules.description: Survey the key models and algorithms that form the basis for most AI applications.
keyLearning: Grasp the function of key models like Regression and Decision Trees
Understand the trade-off between model complexity and interpretability
Recognize which models are suited for which business problems

steps.title: Understanding Attention
steps.content: Attention is like a muscle that can be trained and strengthened. In our digital age, our attention spans are constantly challenged by notifications, multitasking, and information overload.

quiz.question: Attention span can be improved through training and practice.

steps.title: The Pomodoro Technique
steps.content: The Pomodoro Technique involves working in focused 25-minute intervals followed by 5-minute breaks. This method helps maintain concentration while preventing mental fatigue.

quiz.question: In the Pomodoro Technique, how long are the focused work intervals?

steps.title: Managing Digital Distractions
steps.content: Digital devices are designed to capture and hold our attention. Creating boundaries with technology, using app blockers, and establishing device-free zones are essential for deep learning.

quiz.question: Which strategy is most effective for managing digital distractions?
options: Keeping phone nearby but on silent
Using app blockers and device-free zones

keyLearning: Learn the 6 phases of the CRISP-DM framework
Analyze real-world case studies across industries
Identify potential AI use cases within your own function

steps.title: What is Critical Thinking?
steps.content: Critical thinking is the ability to analyze information objectively and make reasoned judgments. It involves evaluating sources, identifying biases, and considering multiple perspectives.

quiz.question: Critical thinking involves only accepting information that confirms your existing beliefs.

steps.title: Identifying Cognitive Biases
steps.content: Cognitive biases are systematic errors in thinking that affect our decisions and judgments. Common biases include confirmation bias, anchoring bias, and availability heuristic.

quiz.question: Which bias involves seeking information that confirms existing beliefs?

steps.title: The CRAAP Test
steps.content: The CRAAP test evaluates sources based on Currency, Relevance, Authority, Accuracy, and Purpose. This framework helps you assess the credibility and reliability of information.

quiz.question: The CRAAP test evaluates sources based on five criteria including currency and accuracy.

modules.title: The Powerhouse: Hardware & LLMs

keyLearning: Understand the role of specialized hardware (GPUs/TPUs)

Explore the landscape of Generative AI

steps.title: The Problem-Solving Process
steps.content: Effective problem-solving follows a structured approach: define the problem, gather information, generate alternatives, evaluate options, implement solutions, and monitor results.

quiz.question: The first step in problem-solving is to generate as many solutions as possible.

steps.title: Creative Problem Solving
steps.content: Creative problem-solving techniques include brainstorming, mind mapping, and lateral thinking. These approaches help you think outside conventional boundaries and discover innovative solutions.

quiz.question: Which technique encourages thinking outside conventional boundaries?

steps.title: Decision Making Frameworks
steps.content: Decision-making frameworks like the decision matrix, pros and cons analysis, and the 10-10-10 rule help you make better choices by systematically evaluating options.

quiz.question: The 10-10-10 rule asks you to consider how you'll feel about a decision in 10 minutes, 10 months, and 10 years.

modules.title: The Responsible Futurist

Evaluate the environmental footprint of AI
Formulate principles for responsible AI deployment

steps.title: The Growth Mindset
steps.content: A growth mindset, as defined by Carol Dweck, is the belief that abilities and intelligence can be developed through dedication and hard work. This mindset is crucial for continuous learning and improvement.

quiz.question: A growth mindset believes that intelligence and abilities are fixed traits.

steps.title: Building Learning Habits
steps.content: Consistent, small daily learning efforts compound over time. The key is to start small, be consistent, and gradually increase the complexity and duration of your learning activities.

quiz.question: Which approach is most effective for building learning habits?
options: Studying for hours only on weekends

steps.title: Your Learning Journey Forward
steps.content: Congratulations on completing this program! Continue your learning journey by setting new goals, seeking challenges, and maintaining the habits you've developed. Remember, learning is a lifelong adventure.

quiz.question: Completing this program marks the end of your learning journey.
